io.multimap

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.multimap.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class Map
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    This class implements a 1:n key-value store where each key is associated with a list of values. For more information please visit the C++ Reference for class Map.
    Author:
    Martin Trenkmann

      Opens or creates a map in directory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(String directory)
    throws Exception
        Opens an already existing map located in directory.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        • the directory does not contain a map

      • Map

        public Map(Path directory)
    throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        Map(String)

      • Map

        public Map(String directory,
   Options options)
    throws Exception
        Opens or creates a map in directory. For the latter, you need to set options.createIfMissing(true). If an error should be raised in case the map already exists, set options.setErrorIfExists(true). When a new map is created other fields in options are used to configure the map's block size and number of partitions. See Options for more information.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        when options.isCreateIfMissing() is false (which is the default)
        • the directory does not contain a map
        when options.isCreateIfMissing() return true and no map exists
        • options.getBlockSize() is zero
        • options.getBlockSize() is not a power of two
        when options.isErrorIfExists() is true
        • the directory already contains a map

      • Map

        public Map(Path directory,
   Options options)
    throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        Map(String, Options)

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(byte[] key,
       byte[] value)
         throws Exception
        Appends value to the end of the list associated with key.

        Acquires:

        • a writer lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • key.size() > Map.Limits.maxKeySize()
        • value.size() > Map.Limits.maxValueSize()
        • the map was opened in read-only mode

      • get

        public Iterator get(byte[] key)
        Returns a read-only iterator for the list associated with key. If the key does not exist, an empty iterator that has no values is returned. A non-empty iterator owns a reader lock on the underlying list and therefore must be closed via Iterator.close() when it is not needed anymore. Not closing iterators leads to deadlocks sooner or later.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a reader lock on the list associated with key.

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(byte[] key)
        Returns true if key is associated with at least one value, false otherwise.

      • removeKey

        public boolean removeKey(byte[] key)
        Removes all values associated with key.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        true if any values have been removed, false otherwise.

      • removeKeys

        public long removeKeys(Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Removes all values associated with keys for which predicate yields true. The predicate can be any callable that implements the Callables.Predicate interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on lists associated with matching keys.
        Returns:
        the number of keys for which any values have been removed.

      • removeValue

        public boolean removeValue(byte[] key,
                  byte[] value)
        Removes the first value from the list associated with key that is equal to value after to byte-wise comparison.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        true if any value has been removed, false otherwise.

      • removeValue

        public boolean removeValue(byte[] key,
                  Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Removes the first value from the list associated with key for which predicate yields true. The predicate can be any callable that implements the Callables.Predicate interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        true if any value has been removed, false otherwise.

      • removeValues

        public long removeValues(byte[] key,
                byte[] value)
        Removes all values from the list associated with key that are equal to value after to byte-wise comparison.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        the number of values removed.

      • removeValues

        public long removeValues(byte[] key,
                Callables.Predicate predicate)
        Removes all values from the list associated with key for which predicate yields true. The predicate can be any callable that implements the Callables.Predicate interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        the number of values removed.

      • replaceValue

        public boolean replaceValue(byte[] key,
                   byte[] oldValue,
                   byte[] newValue)
        Replaces the first value in the list associated with key that is equal to oldValue by newValue.

        Note that a replace operation is actually implemented in terms of a remove of the old value followed by an insert/put of the new value. Thus, the new value is always the last value in the list. In other words, the replacement is not in-place.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        true if any value has been replaced, false otherwise.

      • replaceValue

        public boolean replaceValue(byte[] key,
                   Callables.Function map)
        Replaces the first value in the list associated with key by the result of invoking map. Values for which map returns null are not replaced. The map function can be any callable that implements the Callables.Function interface.

        Note that a replace operation is actually implemented in terms of a remove of the old value followed by an insert/put of the new value. Thus, the new value is always the last value in the list. In other words, the replacement is not in-place.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        true if any value has been replaced, false otherwise.

      • replaceValues

        public long replaceValues(byte[] key,
                 byte[] oldValue,
                 byte[] newValue)
        Replaces each value in the list associated with key that is equal to oldValue by newValue.

        Note that a replace operation is actually implemented in terms of a remove of the old value followed by an insert/put of the new value. Thus, the new value is always the last value in the list. In other words, the replacement is not in-place.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        the number of values replaced.

      • replaceValues

        public long replaceValues(byte[] key,
                 Callables.Function map)
        Replaces each value in the list associated with key by the result of invoking map. Values for which map returns null are not replaced. The map function can be any callable that implements the Callables.Function interface.

        Note that a replace operation is actually implemented in terms of a remove of the old value followed by an insert/put of the new value. Thus, the new value is always the last value in the list. In other words, the replacement is not in-place.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.
        Returns:
        the number of values replaced.

      • forEachKey

        public void forEachKey(Callables.Procedure process)
        Applies process to each key whose list is not empty. The process argument can be any callable that implements the Callables.Procedure interface.

        Acquires a reader lock on the map object.

      • forEachValue

        public void forEachValue(byte[] key,
                Callables.Procedure process)
        Applies process to each value associated with key. The process argument can be any callable that implements the Callables.Procedure interface.

        Acquires:

        • a reader lock on the map object.
        • a writer lock on the list associated with key.

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns true if the map is read-only, false otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
        Flushes all data to disk and ensures that the map is stored in consistent state.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws Throwable
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • importFromBase64

        public static void importFromBase64(Path directory,
                    Path input)
                             throws Exception
        Imports key-value pairs from an input file or directory into the map located in directory. If input refers to a directory all files in that directory will be imported, except hidden files starting with a dot and other sub-directories. A description of the file format can be found in the overview section on the project's website.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if the constructor of Map fails or if the input file or directory cannot be read.

      • importFromBase64

        public static void importFromBase64(Path directory,
                    Path input,
                    Options options)
                             throws Exception
        Same as importFromBase64(Path, Path), but gives the user more control by providing an Options parameter which is passed to the constructor of Map when opening. This way a map can be created if it does not already exist.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • exportToBase64

        public static void exportToBase64(Path directory,
                  Path output)
                           throws Exception
        Exports all key-value pairs from the map located in directory to a file denoted by output. If the file already exists, its content will be overwritten. The generated file is in canonical form as described in the overview section on the project's website.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        • the directory does not contain a map
        • the creation of the output file failed

      • exportToBase64

        public static void exportToBase64(Path directory,
                  Path output,
                  Options options)
                           throws Exception
        Same as exportToBase64(Path, Path), but gives the user more control by providing an Options parameter. Most users will use this to pass a compare function that triggers a sorting of all lists before exporting them.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • optimize

        public static void optimize(Path directory,
            Path output)
                     throws Exception
        Rewrites the map located in directory to the directory denoted by output performing various optimizations. For more details please refer to the overview section on the project's website.

        Acquires a directory lock on directory.

        Throws:
        Exception - if one of the following is true:
        • the directory does not exist
        • the directory cannot be locked
        • the directory does not contain a map
        • the creation of a new map in output failed

      • optimize

        public static void optimize(Path directory,
            Path output,
            Options options)
                     throws Exception
        Same as optimize(Path, Path), but gives the user more control by providing an Options parameter. Most users will use this to pass a compare function that triggers a sorting of all lists.
        Throws:
        Exception
